intro: Linnaeobreynia admirabilis, commonly known as the celestial flame orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red and orange petals, which are adorned with intricate patterns resembling flames. Its flowers bloom once a year, typically during the late spring or early summer. Due to its unique appearance and limited habitat, Linnaeobreynia admirabilis is considered a conservation priority.
